<span class="hljs-section"># Step-3: Trumping-Pro-Argument Free Public Access to TWONs</span>

Main Claims GM-1: Unrestricted Access

<span class="hljs-statement-title">[T-GM-1: Access to TWON should be unrestricted]:</span> It is morally allowed that a TWON is publicly available for an unrestrited use. <span class="hljs-tag">#assum</span>

<span class="hljs-section">## Pro-Arguments #gray</span>

<span class="hljs-argument-title">&lt;A-GM-1-Pro-1-2: Impossibility of TWONs&#x27; Regulation&gt;:</span> It is impossible to install a governance mode which reliably restricts access to the TWONs to a societal group only.<span class="hljs-tag">#(controv)</span> 

<span class="hljs-argument-statement-nr">(1)</span> XYz
<span class="hljs-argument-statement-nr">(2)</span> ZYX
<span class="hljs-inference">----</span>
<span class="hljs-argument-statement-nr">(3)</span> It is impossible to install a governance mode which reliably restricts access to the TWONs to a societal group only.
 <span class="hljs-comment">//-&gt; [GM-3 is feasible]</span>
 <span class="hljs-comment">//-&gt; [GM-4 is feasible]</span>
 <span class="hljs-comment">//-&gt; [GM-2 is feasible]</span>

<span class="hljs-section">### Strategy-1: Debunking Risks</span>

<span class="hljs-argument-title">&lt;A-GM-1-Pro-1&gt;:</span> Benefits without Significant Risks from GM-1<span class="hljs-tag">#(controv)</span> 

<span class="hljs-argument-statement-nr">(1)</span> <span class="hljs-statement-title">[Significant Benefits from GM-1]</span>
<span class="hljs-argument-statement-nr">(2)</span> <span class="hljs-statement-title">[Moral Drawbacks from GM-1 are Insignificant]:</span> It is reasonable to expect that unrestricted public access to the TWON will cause violations of moral norms in an insignificant amount relative to the status quo.<span class="hljs-tag">#controv</span>
<span class="hljs-support"> &lt;+</span> <span class="hljs-argument-title">&lt;A-GM-1-Pro-1-1&gt;</span>
<span class="hljs-argument-statement-nr">(3)</span> If an unrestricted access to a technology T brings about morally significant benefits and the moral drawbacks from its unrestricted access are insignificant, the technology should be freely accessible.  If it is reasonable to expect that a technology T brings about morally significant benefits B and it is reasonable to expect that the moral drawbacks from T&#x27;s realization are insignificant and for all other available means to B it is reasonable to expect that they involve higher moral drawbacks than from T, T ought to be realized.
<span class="hljs-argument-statement-nr">(4)</span> <span class="hljs-statement-title">[No Alternatives to GM-1 without Significant Moral Drawbacks]:</span> According to the best available knowledge, there is no other means by which the benefits (B-1,<span class="hljs-tag">...</span>,B-3) could be realized without significant moral drawbacks.<span class="hljs-tag">#(controv)</span>
<span class="hljs-support"> &lt;+</span> <span class="hljs-argument-title">&lt;A-GM-1-Pro-1-2: Impossibility of TWONs&#x27; Regulation&gt;</span>
 <span class="hljs-comment">//&lt;- &lt;Alternatives to GM-1 with Less Moral Hazards&gt;</span>
<span class="hljs-inference">----</span>
<span class="hljs-argument-statement-nr">(4)</span> <span class="hljs-statement-title">[T-GM-1: Access to TWON should be unrestricted]</span>

<span class="hljs-argument-title">&lt;A-GM-1-Pro-1-1&gt;:</span> Moral Drawbacks from GM-1 are Insignificant<span class="hljs-tag">#(controv)</span>

<span class="hljs-argument-statement-nr">(1)</span> Unrestricted public access to the TWON can potentially bring about the following moral drawbacks: (R1) environmental side-effects from additional resources consumption; (R2) risks for individual quality of life from misuse of personal data; (R3) violation of the right to informational self-determination; (R4) undermining of individual autonomy; (R5) damage to democratic institutions; (R6) reinforcement of existing injustices.
<span class="hljs-argument-statement-nr">(2)</span> It is reasonable to assume that an unrestricted access to a TWON will not induce additional environmental pollution or consumption of non-renewable resources in a morally siginificant amount.
  <span class="hljs-comment">//+ &lt;A-GM-1 No Environmental Risks&gt;: it is reasonbale to assume that an unrestricted access to a TWON will not induce additional environmental pollution or consumption of non-renewable resources in a morally siginificant amount.#controv</span>
<span class="hljs-argument-statement-nr">(3)</span> an unrestricted access to a TWON will not increase the probability of misuse of personal data to a sufficiently high degree. 
  <span class="hljs-comment">//+ &lt;A-GM-1 No Risks for Quality of Life&gt;: it is reasonable to assume that an unrestricted access to a TWON will not increase the probability of misuse of personal data#(controv)</span>
<span class="hljs-argument-statement-nr">(4)</span> an unrestricted access to a TWON will not undermine individual autonomy to a significantly higher degree than it is undermined by existing OSNs.
  <span class="hljs-comment">//+ &lt;A-GM-1 Privacy Threads Debunking&gt;: it is reasonabel to assume that an unrestricted access to a TWON will not undermine individual autonomy to a significantly higher degree than it is undermined by existing OSNs.#(controv)</span>
<span class="hljs-argument-statement-nr">(5)</span> an unrestricted access to a TWON will not damage democratic institutions to a significantly higher degree than the existing OSNs damage them.
<span class="hljs-support">  +</span> <span class="hljs-argument-title">&lt;A-GM-1 Democracy Threads Debunking&gt;:</span> it is reasonable to assume that an unrestricted access to a TWON will not damage democratic institutions to a significantly higher degree than the existing OSNs damage them.<span class="hljs-tag">#(controv)</span>
<span class="hljs-argument-statement-nr">(6)</span> an unrestricted access to a TWON will not reinforce existing injustices to a significantly higher degree than the existing OSNs reinforce existing injustices.
  <span class="hljs-comment">//+ &lt;A-GM-1 Reinforcement of Injustices Debunking&gt;: it is reasonable to assume that an unrestricted access to a TWON will not reinforce injustices beyond the level of injustices which has emerged from the current OSNs. #(controv)</span>
<span class="hljs-inference">----</span>
<span class="hljs-argument-statement-nr">(7)</span> Unrestricted public access to the TWON does not violate any moral norms to a significant degree relative to the status quo and the risks it involves are not significant.
<span class="hljs-attack"> -&gt;</span> <span class="hljs-statement-title">[Moral Drawbacks from GM-1]</span>



<span class="hljs-section">## Benefits and Risks#(assum)</span>

<span class="hljs-section">### Benefits</span>

<span class="hljs-statement-title">[Significant Benefits from GM-1]:</span> Unrestricted public access to the TWON brings about the following morally significant benefits: (B-1) it enhances social welfare and individual quality of life, (B-2) it enables that undermining of societal norms necessary for democratic governance is prevented, (B-3) and it provides means for mitigation of further injustices.<span class="hljs-tag">#(assum)</span>
 <span class="hljs-comment">//&lt;+ [B-1-GM-1: Enhancing Welfare, Improvement of individual quality of life]</span>
 <span class="hljs-comment">//&lt;+ [B-2-3-GM-1: Protection of Democratic Norms]</span>
 <span class="hljs-comment">//&lt;+ [B-2-2-GM-1: Protection of Individual Autonomy]</span>
 <span class="hljs-comment">//&lt;+ [B-3-GM-1: Mitigation of injustices]</span>

<span class="hljs-statement-title">[B-1-GM-1: Enhancing Welfare, Improvement of individual quality of life]:</span> Unrestricted Access to the TWON will increase economic product (in an amount GDP-GM-1) and enable creation of new products and services which will enhance individual quality of life (in an amount QoL-GM-1).

<span class="hljs-statement-title">[B-2-2-GM-1: Protection of Individual Autonomy]:</span> Unrestricted Access to the TWON will allow that undermining of individual autonomy on OSNs is prevented.

<span class="hljs-statement-title">[B-2-3-GM-1: Protection of Democratic Norms]:</span> Unrestricted access to the TWON will allow that violations of epistemic, moral and juridical norms on OSNs necessary for democratic governance are prevented.

<span class="hljs-statement-title">[B-3-GM-1: Mitigation of injustices]:</span> Unrestricted access to the TWON will generate additional knowledge about social systems which will enable creation of new products and services mitigating social injustices.


<span class="hljs-section">### Risks</span>

<span class="hljs-statement-title">[Moral Drawbacks from GM-1]:</span> Unrestricted public access to the TWON can bring about the following moral drawbacks: (R-1) risks for individual quality of life; (R-2-1) violation of the right to informational self-determination; (R-2-2) undermining of individual autonomy; (R-2-3) damage to democratic institutions; (R-3) reinforcement of existing injustices.<span class="hljs-tag">#(assum)</span>
 <span class="hljs-comment">//&lt;+ [R-1-GM-1: Risks to individual quality of life]</span>
 <span class="hljs-comment">//&lt;+ [R-2-1-GM-1: Violations of the right to privacy]</span>
 <span class="hljs-comment">//&lt;+ [R-2-2-GM-1: Intensified undermining of individual autonomy]</span>
 <span class="hljs-comment">//&lt;+ [R-2-3-GM-1: Collapse of Democratic Governance]</span>
 <span class="hljs-comment">//&lt;+ [R-3-1-GM-1: Enforecement of Intergenerational Injustices]</span>
 <span class="hljs-comment">//&lt;+ [R-3-2-GM-1: Reinforcement of existing injustices]</span>

<span class="hljs-statement-title">[R-1-GM-1: Risks to individual quality of life]:</span> it is possible that unrestricted access to the TWON will decrease individual quality of life from misuse of personal data.

<span class="hljs-statement-title">[R-2-1-GM-1: Violations of the right to privacy]:</span> it is possible that an unrestricted access to the TWON will enable that personal data are used without consent more broadly than without the TWON violating the right to informational self-determination.

<span class="hljs-statement-title">[R-2-2-GM-1: Intensified undermining of individual autonomy]:</span> it is possible that an unrestricted access to the TWON will intensify undermining of individual autonomy.

<span class="hljs-statement-title">[R-2-3-GM-1: Collapse of Democratic Governance]:</span> it is possible that unrestricted access to the TWON will lead to additional violation of epistemic, moral, and juridical norms on the OSNs and in public policy.

<span class="hljs-statement-title">[R-3-1-GM-1: Enforecement of Intergenerational Injustices]:</span> it is possible that unrestricted access to the TWON will cause harms to future generations from additional use of resources and environmental pollution.

<span class="hljs-statement-title">[R-3-2-GM-1: Reinforcement of existing injustices]:</span> it is possible that unrestricted access to the TWON will reinforce existing injustices leading to a more unequal distribution of financial and political power. 

</code></pre></div><div slot="map">
